name: Lusaka South Grid Expansion Phase II
description: Phase II expansion of the Lusaka South transmission grid to reduce load shedding and connect 150,000 new customers. Includes 33kV substation upgrades and 220km of distribution lines.

name: Kafue Gorge Lower Hydropower Station - Phase 2
fundingSource: African Development Bank / European Investment Bank / Government of Zambia
description: Construction of the 750MW Kafue Gorge Lower hydroelectric power station to significantly increase national generation capacity and reduce load shedding. Includes dam works, powerhouse, and 220kV transmission evacuation lines.

name: Rural Electrification - Northern Province
description: Extension of the electricity distribution network to 45 rural districts in Northern Province. Targets 80,000 new household connections and 120 new mini-grid installations for off-grid communities.

name: Smart Metering Rollout - Lusaka
description: Deployment of 350,000 smart prepayment meters across Lusaka to improve revenue collection, reduce non-technical losses, and enable remote meter management. Includes AMI head-end system and data analytics platform.

name: Kariba North Bank Extension Rehabilitation
description: Rehabilitation and capacity restoration of the Kariba North Bank hydropower station following damage and sedimentation issues. Includes turbine refurbishment, cavern reinforcement, and generator upgrades to restore 720MW capacity.

name: Itezhi-Tezhi Solar Hybrid Project
description: 30MW solar PV hybrid facility co-located with the existing Itezhi-Tezhi hydropower station to improve water use efficiency and provide year-round renewable energy supply to the Southern Province grid.

name: Lusaka West Substation Upgrade
description: Upgrade of the Lusaka West 132/11kV substation to increase transformer capacity from 40MVA to 80MVA and install modern SCADA-based protection systems, improving supply reliability for 60,000 Lusaka West customers.

name: Zambia Sugar Mill Expansion - Mazabuka
description: Expansion of the Zambia Sugar Nakambala estate mill to increase crushing capacity from 65 to 100 tonnes of cane per hour. Includes new crystallisation plant, co-generation boiler upgrade, and irrigation infrastructure for 8,000 additional hectares of outgrower cane.

name: Kafue Industrial Park Phase II
description: Development of Phase II of the Kafue Industrial Park providing 250 hectares of serviced industrial land, shared utilities, warehousing, and export processing zones. Targets 40 new industrial tenants and 15,000 direct jobs.

name: Maamba Collieries Modernisation
description: Modernisation of Maamba Collieries open-cast coal mining operations including fleet replacement, washery upgrade, and infrastructure improvements to increase production from 400,000 to 700,000 tonnes per annum.

name: Zambia Breweries Expansion - Ndola
description: Expansion of the Zambia Breweries Ndola facility to add a new 500,000 hectolitre production line targeting Northern, Copperbelt and Luapula province markets. Includes new packaging hall, water treatment plant, and solar PV rooftop system.

name: ZCCM-IH Copper Downstream Processing Facility
fundingSource: IDC / Government of Zambia / Foreign Direct Investment
description: Establishment of a copper rod and cable manufacturing facility to add value to Zambian copper before export. Target capacity of 150,000 tonnes per annum of copper rod. Project aligns with GRZ value-addition strategy under the 8th National Development Plan.

name: Agrifoods Processing Hub - Eastern Province
description: Development of an integrated agrifoods processing hub in Chipata serving Eastern Province smallholder farmers. Includes maize milling (200,000 MT capacity), soya processing, cold storage, and a grain trading platform connecting 50,000 smallholder farmers.

name: Zambia Telecommunications Infrastructure Fund
description: Co-investment fund for deployment of fibre optic backbone infrastructure across major Zambian cities and the TAZARA and Great North Road corridors. Delivered 4,200km of fibre connecting 12 towns and enabling wholesale broadband services.

name: Digital Banking Platform Transformation
description: Full digital transformation of ZANACO retail and SME banking channels including new mobile banking super-app, USSD 2.0 platform, API banking layer for fintechs, and AI-powered customer service. Targets 2 million active digital users by 2026.

name: Branch Network Expansion - Rural Zambia
description: Establishment of 35 new full-service branches and 80 satellite banking units in underserved rural and peri-urban areas. Targets provinces with less than 1 branch per 50,000 adults including Luapula, Northern and Western provinces.

name: Core Banking System Upgrade
fundingSource: ZANACO Internal Funds / International Finance Corporation (IFC)
description: Full migration from legacy Finacle 7 to T24 Transact core banking platform. Delivered a unified real-time processing environment for all 62 branches, improved 24/7 availability to 99.95%, and enabled open API integration with mobile money operators.

name: SME Lending Programme Scale-up
fundingSource: Bank of Zambia MSME Facility / ZANACO Internal Funds
description: Scale-up of the ZANACO SME loan portfolio to ZMW 1.5 billion targeting 15,000 small and medium enterprises. Includes a new credit scoring model, digital loan origination, and partnership with PACRA for automated business verification.

name: Agency Banking Rollout - Peri-Urban Areas
description: Rollout of 2,000 ZANACO agent banking points in peri-urban townships and rural growth centres. Agents provide cash-in, cash-out, account opening, and bill payment services, extending financial access beyond the branch network.

name: Cybersecurity Infrastructure Enhancement
description: Uplift of ZANACO cybersecurity controls including Security Operations Centre (SOC) establishment, endpoint detection and response (EDR), multi-factor authentication rollout, and penetration testing programme. Aligns with Bank of Zambia cyber resilience guidelines.

name: Trade Finance Platform Upgrade
fundingSource: ZANACO Internal Funds / African Development Bank
description: Implementation of a new trade finance processing platform to automate letters of credit, documentary collections, and guarantees. Targets a 60% reduction in processing time and expanded regional trade finance capacity supporting Zambian exporters.

name: Dar es Salaam Corridor Track Rehabilitation
fundingSource: African Development Bank / TAZARA / Government of Zambia
description: Comprehensive rehabilitation of 800km of the TAZARA corridor track within Zambia including rail replacement, sleeper renewal, ballast cleaning, and bridge reinforcement. Targets an increase in axle load capacity from 18 to 22.5 tonnes and line speed from 60 to 100km/h.

name: Locomotive Fleet Renewal Phase I
fundingSource: Government of Zambia / China Exim Bank
description: Procurement of 24 new diesel-electric locomotives with 2,400HP capacity to replace retired GE U20C and GM locomotives. Includes crew training, spare parts inventory and maintenance workshop upgrade at Kabwe depot.

name: Livingstone Station Modernisation
fundingSource: Zambia Tourism Agency / Government of Zambia
description: Restoration and modernisation of Livingstone Railway Station as a heritage tourism asset and operational hub. Includes facade restoration, passenger amenities upgrade, new freight marshalling yard, and Victoria Falls tourist steam train platform.

name: Copperbelt Freight Capacity Expansion
fundingSource: Mining Companies (FQM, Vedanta, Glencore) / Government of Zambia
description: Capacity expansion of the Copperbelt freight corridor to increase copper concentrate and finished copper transport from 2 million to 3.5 million tonnes per annum. Includes new passing loops, yard upgrades at Ndola and Kitwe, and 500 new ore wagons.

name: Lusaka Central Station Redevelopment
fundingSource: Government of Zambia / Private Sector Partners
description: Mixed-use redevelopment of the Lusaka Central Railway Station precinct into a modern intermodal transport hub integrating rail, bus rapid transit (BRT), and urban commuter services. Includes commercial retail development to cross-subsidise transport infrastructure.

name: Safety Management System Implementation
description: Enterprise-wide implementation of a digital Safety Management System (SMS) covering incident reporting, hazard identification, risk assessment, and corrective action tracking across all ZR depots, stations and operating areas. Achieved RTSA certification.

name: Chipata-Petauke Rail Extension Feasibility Study
description: Comprehensive feasibility study for a 280km rail extension from Chipata to Petauke to serve Eastern Province agrifoods trade. Study delivered route alignment, demand forecast, financial model, and environmental pre-assessment. Recommended phased construction approach.

name: Zambia Cobalt Refinery Stake Acquisition
description: Strategic acquisition of a 25% stake in a proposed cobalt hydroxide refinery to be located in the Copperbelt SEZ. The refinery will process cobalt from DRC and Zambian sources, capturing value-add beyond raw cobalt exports. Due diligence commenced November 2024.

name: Emerald Mining Joint Venture — Gemfields Kagem
description: ZCCM-IH acquiring a 25% free-carry stake in the Kagem Emerald Mining JV alongside Gemfields Group (75%). Kagem is the world largest emerald mine in Lufwanyama District. MOU signed June 2024. JV agreement under negotiation. Adds commodity diversification to ZCCM-IH copper portfolio.

name: Copper Smelting Capacity Investment
description: Investigation of ZCCM-IH investment in a new copper smelter in Zambia to capture value-add in the copper value chain. Zambia currently exports ~70% of copper as concentrate. Feasibility study commissioned Q1 2025 with potential partners including Trafigura and Glencore.

name: Mopani Copper Mines Rehabilitation Investment
description: ZCCM-IH investment in rehabilitation and re-capitalisation of Mopani Copper Mines following GRZ acquisition from Glencore. ZCCM-IH holds 90% of Mopani. Covers underground mine rehabilitation, processing plant refurbishment, safety improvements, and working capital. Mopani expected to resume full production of 100,000t copper per annum by 2026.

name: North-Western Province Exploration JV
description: Greenfield copper and cobalt exploration JV in North-Western Province Kabompo and Mwinilunga districts. ZCCM-IH holds 30% free-carry stake alongside exploration partner Ivanhoe Mines (70%). Exploration programme includes airborne geophysics, soil sampling, and initial drill testing. Results expected Q4 2025.

name: Gold Refinery Phase 2 Capacity Expansion
fundingSource: Government of Zambia / Trade Development Bank / Internal Funds
description: Expansion of the Zambia Gold Company gold refinery in Lusaka from 2 tonnes per month to 5 tonnes per month processing capacity. The project includes installation of additional smelting furnaces, assay laboratory upgrade, secure vault expansion, and site infrastructure. Expansion will position Zambia Gold as the primary gold refining hub for the region.

name: Gold Buying Centres Network Expansion
description: Establishment of a network of 20 gold buying centres across Zambia's key artisanal mining regions including North-Western Province (Mufumbwe, Mwinilunga, Kabompo), Muchinga Province (Mpika), and Copperbelt Province (Chingola, Kitwe). Centres provide competitive gold pricing, on-site assay, and same-day payment services to formalise artisanal and small-scale miners.

name: Artisanal Mining Formalisation Programme Phase 2
fundingSource: Government of Zambia / World Bank MISA Programme
description: Phase 2 of the national artisanal and small-scale mining (ASM) formalisation programme. Targets registration and licensing of 5,000 artisanal miners, provision of equipment grants for mercury-free processing, safety training, environmental compliance support, and financial literacy workshops. Implemented in partnership with Ministry of Mines and the World Bank Minerals Investment and Sector Assistance programme.
